description:
Support title release projects from start to completion by helping to define project scope and objectives, identify key stakeholders, create project plan, and maintain cross functional alignment Manage backfill and other retailer-based projects across multiple teams and stakeholders while identifying and securing required resources to meet project goals and delivery timelines Maintain thorough and clear documentation for duration of title and retailer-based projects to ensure transparency, accountability, and collaboration Identify potential risks to project timelines, employ problem solving, and develop mitigation strategies to ensure project success while collaborating across retailers and internal stakeholders Troubleshoot systems and reporting issues impacting title releases Assess and adapt existing workflows to new strategies and to enable greater operational efficiencies for supply chain Engage in data scrubbing to ensure system accuracy and clean data flow to maintain alignment around titles release strategies Support Sr. Director by providing indirect oversight of operations team and workflows Provide direction and operational expertise on ad hoc projects supporting business initiatives

Quals--

owns and operates over 20 different businesses across 30 countries including a valuable portfolio of news and entertainment television networks, a premier motion picture company, significant television production operations, a leading television stations group, world-renowned theme parks and a premium ad-supported streaming service.

Minimum 4 years of professional, project management, or related field experience Strong organizational and analytical skills Excellent interpersonal, writing, and communication skills Proficiency using Microsoft Office including Excel

Eligibility Requirements:

Interested candidates must submit a resume/CV online to be considered Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States Must be covered by Solutions, NBCU’s Alternative Dispute Resolution Program Must be willing to work in Universal City, CA

Desired Characteristics

A team-player who can successfully operate in a team-oriented setting and possesses exceptional interpersonal, communication, and critical thinking skills Detail-oriented self-starter who loves efficiency and is passionate about creating solutions Strong work ethic with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage workload across multiple projects Highly adaptable and excels in fast-paced environments Ability to work under pressure
